spoken-english-week13_key1:
Hello!! 
This is your Class 13 for Spoken English course module.
spoken-english-week13_key4: Explain to them the concept of giving
spoken-english-week13_key5: When was the last time you helped someone you know and how?
spoken-english-week13_key6: How did you feel after helping someone
spoken-english-week13_key7: Why is it important to give
spoken-english-week13_key9:
Finish the Story Game:
The Finish the story game is a fun group activity which develops students storytelling, communication skill, sentence making and grammar. The aim of the game is to create a complete story as a team. Going around in a circle each player will contribute one sentence to the story.
spoken-english-week13_key10:
Example:
Volunteer: As the rain poured, I walked to…
spoken-english-week13_key13: Student: Dancing. So I asked him…
spoken-english-week13_key14: Volunteer: What are you doing here? He replied…
spoken-english-week13_key15: Student: I’m here to eat you all! I ran…
spoken-english-week13_key16: Volunteer: To my mom’s house. And shouted…
spoken-english-week13_key17: Student: Mom, where’s my lunch? She said…
spoken-english-week13_key18: Volunteer: Your lunch is at school. So I walked…
spoken-english-week13_key20: Volunteer: The alien had my lunch. However…
spoken-english-week13_key21: Student: That alien was my dad. And then…
spoken-english-week13_key22: Volunteer: We laughed. My dad called me a…

spoken-english-week13_key29:
As I was leaving the house,
Word of the Week
Empower (verb): make (someone) stronger and more confident,
especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
Eg. My passion lies in empowering and uplifting others.
spoken-english-week13_key31:
Pair and Share: (For each question - first volunteer shares, then student)

spoken-english-week13_key58: Empathy (noun): the ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
spoken-english-week13_key59: Example: I have empathy for my mother’s difficulties
spoken-english-week13_key60:
Empathy vs. Sympathy: Sympathy means pity or feeling sorrow forsomeone else (from a distance); Empathy is actually allowing
yourself to fully feel the other person’s feelings by putting yourself in the other person’s shoes
